column1: #Text=- This code is an official implementation of "[*PSTR: End-to-End One-Step Person Search With Transformers (CVPR2022)*](https://arxiv.org/abs/2204.03340)"
#Text=- **End-to-end one-step person search** with Transformers, which does not requre NMS post-processing.
#Text=- **Pre-trained models** with ResNet50, ResNet50-DCN, and PVTv2b2.
#Text=- **Curves of different methods** on CUHK under different gallery sizes ([plot_cuhk.py](plot_cuhk.py)).
#Text=If you want to add new results, please feel free to contact us.
#Text=- We install this project using cuda11.1 and PyTorch1.8.0 (or PyTorch1.9.0) as follows.
#Text=# Create a new conda enviroment for PSTR
#Text=#conda install pytorch==1.8.0 torchvision==0.9.0 torchaudio==0.8.0 cudatoolkit=11.1 -c pytorch -c conda-forge
#Text=# Comiple mmcv, which has been included in this project

#Text=- If you have the problem ```local variable 'beta1' referenced before assignment``` with PyTorch1.8, add one table space in L110 of [```optim/adamw.py```](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/55740)
#Text=- If you want to output the results of different models, please  change CONFIGPATH, MODELPATH, OUTPATH for diffferent models
#Text=We provide some models with different backbones and results on PRW and CUHK-SYSU datasets, which have a little difference to CVPR version due to jitter
#Text=|    name  | dataset  | backbone |  mAP  | top-1 |  mAP+ | top-1+  | download|
#Text=- All the models are based on multi-scale training and all the results are based on single-scale inference

#Text=- \\+ indicates adding a re-scoring module during evaluation, where we modify the final matching score as the weighted score of [CBGM](https://github.com/serend1p1ty/SeqNet) score and originial matching scores.
#Text=If the project helps your research, please cite this paper.
#Text=  author =       {Jiale Cao and Yanwei Pang and Rao Muhammad Anwer and Hisham Cholakkal and Jin Xie and Mubarak Shah and Fahad Shahbaz Khan},
#Text=  title =        {PSTR: End-to-End One-Step Person Search With Transformers},
#Text=IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition},

#Text=Many thanks to the open source codes: [mmdetection](https://github.com/open-mmlab/mmdetection), [AlignPS](https://github.com/daodaofr/AlignPS), and [SeqNet](https://github.com/serend1p1ty/SeqNet).
